title: Velas Beach
subtitle: Turtle nesting haven and eco-tourism escape in Konkan
overview: Velas Beach is a quaint and clean beach located in the Ratnagiri district of Maharashtra. It is best known for its Olive Ridley turtle conservation project, where baby turtles hatch and are released into the sea during nesting season.
This beach is part of an eco-friendly village that promotes sustainable tourism. Visitors can witness natural turtle hatchings and enjoy a peaceful coastal environment surrounded by greenery.
Apart from the beach, Velas offers a unique rural Konkan experience with local food, homestays, and scenic treks.

highlights.title: Turtle Festival
highlights.description: Watch baby Olive Ridley turtles hatch and make their way to the sea (Feb–March).

highlights.title: Village Homestays
highlights.description: Stay with local families and enjoy authentic Konkani cuisine and hospitality.

highlights.title: Eco-Tourism
highlights.description: Environmentally conscious tourism promoting wildlife and conservation.

highlights.title: Scenic Treks
highlights.description: Trek to Bankot Fort or through lush hills for panoramic coastal views.

geography.intro: Velas is a coastal village located in the northern part of Ratnagiri district. It lies near the mouth of the Savitri River and is surrounded by forested hills and untouched nature.

details.label: Flora
details.value: Dense greenery, cashew plantations, coconut palms

climate.description: Velas has a tropical climate. Summers are warm, monsoons are lush and rainy, and winters are pleasant.

geography.conclusion: Velas is an ideal destination for nature lovers and conservation-minded travelers seeking an authentic village beach experience.

activities.title: Turtle Watching
activities.description: Watch baby turtles hatch and crawl toward the sea during the annual Turtle Festival.

activities.title: Village Walks
activities.description: Walk through the quiet village lanes and explore local life and traditions.

activities.title: Bankot Fort Trek
activities.description: A short trek to the historical Bankot Fort overlooking the Savitri river delta and sea.

attractions.title: Bankot Fort
attractions.description: Historic fort with stunning views of the sea and river confluence.

attractions.title: Harihareshwar Temple
attractions.description: A sacred coastal temple complex just an hour's drive from Velas.

attractions.title: Anjarle Beach
attractions.description: Another quiet beach known for its turtle conservation and clean sands.

marineLife.intro: Velas beach is part of an ecological effort to protect marine biodiversity, especially the Olive Ridley turtle species.

items.title: Olive Ridley Turtles
items.description: Endangered sea turtles that nest on the Velas shore annually.

items.title: Mangroves & Dunes
items.description: Vital coastal buffers that provide protection and breeding habitat.

items.title: Coastal Fish & Crabs
items.description: Small marine species visible in shallow tidal pools.

conclusion: Velas’s marine ecology is protected by community-based tourism and seasonal visitor guidelines.
The beach promotes awareness of wildlife conservation and responsible travel.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Travel to Mangaon by train or car, then local road to Velas

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Take shared jeeps or buses to Velas

howToReach.title: By Road
details: Approx. 220 km from Mumbai via NH66
Scenic route through hills and coast

bookingTips.description: Visit during Feb–March for Turtle Festival
Book village homestays in advance during the season
Road conditions are rough — prefer SUVs or travel early
